title: Gap connector
text: When transitioning from prior work to limitations, start with a contrastive connector (However/Nevertheless/Yet) and state the gap explicitly.

title: Problem statement
text: Define the task in one sentence with a measurable objective; avoid vague phrasing like 'is important' without specifying why.

title: Approach preview
text: Use 'In this paper, we propose/present' to preview the key idea at a high level before details.

title: Contributions list
text: State contributions as a short enumerated list; keep each item parallel in grammar and scope.

title: Roadmap sentence
text: Include a short roadmap sentence that mentions Section 2/3/4 to guide the reader.

title: Hedging broad claims
text: Use may/might/likely for broad claims; avoid always/never unless strictly proven.

title: Evidence-first rule
text: Any style rule should cite an example paragraph or caption from the mentor papers; otherwise downgrade it as a suggestion.
